items.sentence: I can\'t thank you enough for the help you\'ve given me.
Tom lives on the third floor of this apartment building.
Tom looked at the menu and decided to order a hamburger.
Tom looked through the peephole before opening the door.
Tom told the doctor he\'d fainted three times last week.
Tom complained that he didn\'t have enough time to read.
Tom couldn\'t believe that Mary had actually kissed him.
Tom couldn\'t count to ten until he was three years old.
Tom couldn\'t decide whether to go to Boston or Chicago.
The last thing I want to do is come between you and Tom.
The last time I saw Tom he was headed towards the beach.
The last time I saw Tom, he was ranting about something.
The man I met in the park told me that his name was Tom.
The man I was talking to earlier never told me his name.
The old lady lived in a three-room apartment by herself.
I\'m pretty sure that Tom wouldn\'t know how to do that.
I\'m sorry I couldn\'t make it to your party last night.
My brother would often stay up all night reading novels.
My older brother was the one who taught me how to drive.
If Tom had had something to throw, he\'d have thrown it.
